intro: Elatostema lasiocephalum, commonly known as the woolly star, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. It produces small greenish-white flowers that are clustered together, and it is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Elatostema lasiocephalum is a perennial herb that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
